It’s common knowledge that discarding old electronics with regular trash is inappropriate. Many stores provide drop-off boxes for unwanted electronics like phones and batteries, and communities often organize special recycling events. Selling old electronics is also a viable option. Why then is the United Nations issuing warnings about an impending e-waste crisis?
